header.title: The Demonic Bible
header.category: Western Esotericism, Occultism, Demonology, Chaos Magic, Satanism, Thelema

central_thesis: Man's ultimate purpose is to become God through a progressive process of self-initiation, conscious expansion of the psyche (XEPER), and realization of personal divinity (DEITUS), thereby ushering in and embodying the Aeon of Lucifer. This involves rejecting conventional dogma, integrating 'dark forces' as aspects of the self and universal consciousness, and actively wielding magical will to reshape reality.

structure_content.summary: Advocates for a new artistic and human evolution beyond personal introspection, aiming for numinous, supra-personal goals, the creation of higher beings, new civilizations, and aeons.

Emphasizes Satanism as individualism and the self as God, rejecting dogmatic forms. Proclaims the 'Aeon of Lucifer' as man's rise to godhood, facilitated by scientific and technological advancements, all encapsulated by the Word DEITUS.

Contextualizes the 'Demonic Bible' as a foundational text for 'deitic magic', deeply influenced by Thelemic, Setian, and ONA systems. Stresses the psychological impact of its rituals, warning against improper use, and highlights THELEMA and XEPER as paths to DEITUS.

Introduces the Embassy of Lucifer as a political and philosophical organization dedicated to advancing DEITUS. It synthesizes elements from Church of Satan, Temple of Set, OTO/AA, and ONA, focusing on personal godhood and defining DEITUS as 'Will to Come into Being as a God'.

Provides a historical overview of Lucifer's transformation from light-bearer to Christian devil. Discusses Gnostic Luciferan beliefs, secret societies (Freemasons, Golden Dawn), Dr. John Dee's Enochian magic, and Aleister Crowley's Aeon of Horus, linking these to the broader occult context.

Autobiographical account of the author's occult journey, including contact with the spirit Azael and the revelation of the Demonic Bible's rituals. Describes a transformative 'crossing of the abyss' leading to his realization as a 'Magus' and the declaration of DEITUS.

Details the EOL's establishment as a 'political embassy' for the Dark Lord and a vehicle for the Aeon of Lucifer/DEITUS. It aims to unite Satanists and foster an independent Satanic state, distinguishing itself from a traditional church and emphasizing an evolving philosophy.

Explains magic as a means of mental control, influencing reality through telepathy, magnetism, and thought-forms by transforming the brain into a 'transmitter'. Emphasizes that magic operates on the subconscious, irrational mind and requires belief.

Posits a dynamic, ever-changing universe, where 'God' is also 'becoming'. Satan is presented as the truer reflection of this universal dynamic consciousness, contrasting with static, traditional definitions of God.

Critiques Christianity's evolution from intellectual philosophy to authoritarian dogma, leading to suppression. Offers a 'satanic' reinterpretation of biblical figures, including Jesus, as practitioners of the Black Arts.

Explores the power of words in magic, drawing parallels to Cabalistic and ancient mythologies where words create reality and command spirits. Discusses the concept of magical aeons and distinguishes between Right-Hand and Left-Hand Path magic based on the intent to affect change.

Defines THELEMA (true Will), XEPER (continuous evolution/becoming), and DEITUS (realization of man's godhood/embodiment of Universal Will). Stresses that stagnation is anathema, and this triad represents the Law of the Aeon of Lucifer for attaining divinity.

Describes DEITUS as the achievement of God-like power, where man becomes God and embodies Satan as the universe's 'dynamic'. It is the third aeon in an expansion cycle, building on Horus (THELEMA) and Set (XEPER), marking man's ultimate destiny as gods.

Argues that logical existence is an illusion, the universe being a dream of a single, sleeping consciousness. Individual consciousnesses are manifestations of this dynamic consciousness (Satan), and true self-realization involves embracing this inner divinity.

Discusses human sacrifice as a means to release magical energy for rituals, while acknowledging legal constraints. Proclaims Satanists' superiority and their right to define their own ethics, valuing a Satanist's life above thousands of others.

A detailed exposition on DEITUS as the Word of the Aeon of Lucifer, meaning 'Will to Come Into Being as a God'. It synthesizes Thelemic, Setian, and ONA philosophies, advocating for self-creation, individuality, and the rejection of external dogma to achieve godhood.

Presents the 'Demonic Bible' rituals as a system for self-initiation, revealed by Azael. It draws from grimoire traditions but focuses on internalizing archetypes rather than external conjuration, warning of potential psychological breakdown if misused.

Suggests adaptability of the rituals, allowing integration with other magical systems while emphasizing strict adherence to the Demonic Bible's order. Reiterates warnings about psychological risks ('demonic possession', 'mental illness') if rituals are performed improperly.

Explains demonic names as symbolic archetypes for the 'Dark God' or 'Dark Goddess', identifying Tiamat as the original female Devil. Discusses the historical masculinization of the Devil due to Christian influence.

Introduces the practical sequence of rituals for purification, renunciation, consecration, and various invocations, designed to progressively align the practitioner with 'Forces of Darkness' and achieve self-deification.

Details invocations of the Four Demon Kings (Mahazael, Samael, Zimimay, Corson) who rule the Earth's quarters, signaling to demonic powers that a Satanic magician is about to 'Cross the Gates of Hell'.
Outlines rituals to invoke Satan, Lucifer, Belial, and Leviatan to 'Open wide the Gates of Hell' and become the 'Devil Incarnate', merging with these archetypal forces.

Involves invocations of eight Sub-Princes (Astarot, Magot, Asmodee, Belzebud, Oriens, Paimon, Ariton, Amaimon) to 'open the Locks of the Abyss', building upon the initial 'Crossing the Gates of Hell' rituals.

structure_content.chapter_title: Opening the Nine Locks of the Abyss
structure_content.summary: A ritual sequence to open nine symbolic 'locks' of the Abyss by invoking specific Lords of the Abyss (Paimon, Amaymon, Asmodeus, Beelzebub, Astaroth, Oriens, Magot, Dagon, Moloch), leading to further immersion into chaotic realms.

Lists the 72 Lords of the Djinn from the Goetia of Solomon, noting their powers and forms. These are to be invoked after opening the Locks of the Abyss, with the magician aiming to become an ally, rather than using threats or coercion, to gain power and knowledge.

Includes rituals of 'Baptism' (in River Styx/Flames of Hell) and invocations of the Lord and Queen of the Underworld (Pluto, Hades, Persephone, Hela) for symbolic death, rebirth in Satan's image, and achieving sexual union with non-physical entities through astral projection.
Describes how to invoke demonic spirits associated with planetary spheres (e.g., Marduk's 50 Names for the Jovial Sphere), aiming to gain power and knowledge from these entities.
Outlines rituals to descend into the 'Realm of Chaos' by crossing seven gates and invoking various chaos entities like Ereshkigal, Azag-Thoth, Lillith, Kingu, and Absu.

structure_content.chapter_title: Invocation of the Ancient One, Tiamat
structure_content.summary: A profound invocation dedicating body, mind, soul, life, and lineage to Tiamat, the 'Ancient One' and 'Dragon of Chaos', symbolizing a marriage and union with primordial chaotic forces.

Presents a list of specific 'abominations of chaos' (e.g., HUMWAWA, PAZUZU, AKHKHARU, LALASSU, GELAL, LILIT, XASTUR) to be invoked after achieving union with Tiamat, further integrating chaotic energies.

structure_content.chapter_title: Crossing the Nine Spheres (Nine Angles between the worlds)
structure_content.summary: Describes rituals to look into the 'Abyss' (the acausal realm) by staring into a mirror and invoking entities like Set, Shiva, Kali, and MelekTaus, warning that this confrontation reveals the self and can 'consume/destroy the deluded'.

structure_content.chapter_title: The Grimoire of AbraMelin the Mage
structure_content.summary: Lists hierarchical demonic entities (Four Crown Princes, Eight Sub-Princes) and numerous associated spirits, providing context for the invocations used in the Demonic Bible, particularly from LaVey's sources.

Introduces Enochian Keys (1-18) as calls to angelic/demonic orders, interpreted as means to 'wage war on the heavens' and gain control, with LaVey's Satanic interpretations alongside Dee's original translations.

structure_content.chapter_title: The Call of the 30 Ayres (or 19th Enochian Key)
structure_content.summary: Explains the 30 Ayres as spirits governing earth and heavens, capable of changing reality. Invoking them allows the magician to directly influence the 'Aeonic Sphere' and become a 'Magus' who declares new laws and aeons.

A ritual involving the recitation of Enochian Keys and the 30 Ayres, intended to symbolically battle angels, crucify religious figures (Jesus, Virgin Mary), and mock Cabalistic/monotheistic deities, signifying the magician's ultimate conquest and assumption of divine authority.

The ultimate ritual for declaring the Word DEITUS, symbolizing the destruction of the old and creation of a new universe, establishing the practitioner as Magus of the Aeon of Lucifer and initiating the 'Homo Deitus' race.

key_concepts.definition: The Word of the Aeon of Lucifer, signifying the achievement of personal godhood. It is the realization that man is God, the ultimate aim of the expansion of consciousness, and becoming a manifestation of the dynamic consciousness of the universe.

The Greek word for 'Will,' referring to one's true destiny or purpose. In this context, it is the magical Will of the magician's 'higher self,' not merely personal desires, and aligns with the dictum 'Do what thou wilt shall be the whole of the Law'.

An Egyptian word meaning 'to become' or 'to come into being,' representing the continuous expansion and evolution of consciousness through a dialectic process of thesis, antithesis, and synthesis. Stagnation is its anathema.

The current magical age, initiated by Magus Tsirk Susej in 2000 CE, wherein man has become God, Lucifer has risen, and the ancient ones rule. It builds upon previous aeons (Horus, Set) and emphasizes personal divinity and responsibility as gods on Earth.

The spirit that revealed the rituals of the Demonic Bible to Magus Tsirk Susej. It serves as an internal guide and source of revelation, analogous to the Holy Guardian Angel but explicitly 'unholy' to align with the text's philosophy.

Archetypal entities, gods, and demons existing within the subconscious or acausal realm. The objective is not external invocation, but for the practitioner to 'become' these forces, actualizing aspects of their psyche and stimulating parts of the brain for power, knowledge, and enlightenment.
A non-spatial, non-temporal reality existing outside the causal, three-dimensional world. 'Dark gods' or 'demons' are said to reside here, and the magician becomes a 'nexus' or 'gate' to this realm.

The religion of the self, the ego, the god within; an embrace of individualism and freedom of thought. Satan is presented as an archetype of carnality and the dynamic, evolving consciousness of the universe, rather than a literal external devil to be worshipped.

The ability of the human mind to effect change in events or situations through will, intense emotional desire, and absolute faith. It operates on the subconscious, irrational mind, utilizing telepathy, magnetism, and thought-forms, and is developed through experience rather than mere spells.

A series of initiatory rituals designed to open elemental and angular gates through invocations of the Four Crown Princes of Hell (Satan, Lucifer, Belial, Leviatan), to achieve a symbolic union and identification with the 'Forces of Darkness'.

A concept representing angles above the Earth, incrementing by 20 degrees from the southern to northern horizon, totaling 72 'Lords of the Djinn'. These locks are opened through invocation, granting the magician power over spirits dwelling on Earth.

The active, evolving principle of the universe, characterized by continuous change and development. It is allegorically represented as Satan and is distinct from the passive 'universal subconscious' (God), penetrating and influencing it.

The 'new race' or 'superior race' that humanity is evolving into during the Aeon of Lucifer. These are higher beings who have realized their divine potential and act as gods upon the Earth, embodying the Law of DEITUS.

practical_system.description: The system outlines a progressive, long-term magical operation of 'deitic magic' for self-initiation and the 'evolution of man into a being equal to a God'. It involves a sequence of rituals designed to transform the practitioner's consciousness and integrate 'Forces of Darkness' as internal archetypes rather than external entities. The goal is to 'become' the invoked demonic powers, stimulating specific brain areas to achieve power, knowledge, and enlightenment. The process involves symbolic death and rebirth, crossing various 'gates' and 'spheres' representing planes of consciousness and realms of chaos, culminating in the declaration of DEITUS and the establishment of the practitioner as a god and Magus of the Aeon of Lucifer.
tools: Salt water (rock or sea salt) for purification
Incense (patchouli or sandalwood) and incense burner
Chalice (any cup) and 'elixir' (any liquid, coffee suggested)
Mirror (for Crossing the Nine Spheres ritual)

For Group Rituals: Sword, Dagger or Athame, Bell, Gong, Brass Thurifer, Cauldron or Burning Dish, 'Unholy' Bread, Libation Dish, Black Hooded Robes, Baphomet Amulets or Pentagram Amulets, Trapezoidal Altar, Black Altar Cloth with inverted pentagram, 'Symbol of Baphomet' or 'Setian Pentagram' Wall Plaque, Upside-down Cross

relevant_quotes.text: The Demonic Bible by Magus Tsirk Susej, Antichrist servant & disciple of the Dark Lord as revealed to him by his Unholy Guardian Demon the spirit Azael

Satanism encourages individual growth and development. Satanism is individualism. With this in mind, no two Satanists will share the same exact definition of what Satanism is. It is, in fact, this which they hold in common.
In this Age man has become God. It is within man's power to determine his own reality and establish his own law. He is no longer bound by anything greater than his imagination.
THELEMA, XEPER, DEITUS
Our ultimate goal is the evolution of man into a being equal to a God.
This is not a “work of fiction” but rather the foundation of what is now known as deitic magic.
The reader ignores at his own peril the author’s warnings that improper use of the rituals can lead to a psychological breakdown with reality.
It is only by THELEMA and XEPER that one can attain DEITUS.
Stop now at the horror of these words and cower in fear for your immortal soul, or read on and discover true and undefiled wisdom... for enlightenment speaks to the brave.
The Word of the Aeon is DEITUS for man has become god, Lucifer has risen, the Gates have been opened, the Heavens have been conquered, and the Ancient Ones rule once more.
Each member of the Embassy is a god capable of bending reality to his will.
DEITUS is about personal godhood, a "coming into being" as a god.
The Demonic Bible is therefore not a book of rituals to be parroted. It is a personal text representing my path to DEITUS.
The ultimate goal is the evolution of a higher being, both personally and super-personally, for it is both psychological and physical/genetic change which is sought.
What I know is that in this Aeon man has become a god and it is up to each individual to realize himself as a god and act accordingly.

The magician who engages in this sort of activity is not a common sociopath or child molester who derives pleasure from torturing or killing an innocent victim. Rather, the magician in question draws on magical energy released by the emotionally charged victim and directs that energy to affect the world in some way.
Satanists are superior. The masses exist to serve. The life of one Satanist is worth the lives of a hundred thousand men.

The Aeon of Lucifer began May 5, 2000 with the declaration of the word DEITUS, an event coinciding with extensive research being conducted in genetic manipulation and increasing international cooperation between scientists on the "human genome project".

The objective of this system of magic is not to "invoke" Satan to physical appearance (for that would be mere hallucination) but rather to become Satan (or to actualize that aspect of the psyche which is called "Satan"); not to "invoke" Lucifer but to become Lucifer; not to "invoke" Belial but to become Belial; not to "invoke" Leviathan but to become Leviathan. The goal of this magical system is to achieve power, knowledge, and enlightenment by stimulating those parts of the brain which have been called the "Forces of Darkness".
Improper use of these rituals can cause "demonic possession", "mental illness" or abnormal psychological states. Proceed cautiously through these rites taking each step in turn.
When you attain DEITUS, you become a manifestation of the dynamic consciousness of the universe... you become the very embodiment of God or Satan.

The Demonic Bible is written upon parchment made from human flesh in ink made from human blood in a strange alien script, the language of the daemons, dark gods from a time before the creation of man.

A mirror may be placed on the altar beneath the chalice or on the wall behind the altar. Be warned however, that to look into the abyss is to see oneself… this ritual will consume/destroy the deluded.

I crucify Jesus upon his cross. I rape the Virgin Mary and make her my concubine. I mock the Cabala saying, “I am the Yod He Vau He, I am the Divine Tetragrammaton, I am Yahweh, I am Allah, I am the Elohim.” I mock the Cabala as I sit upon the Throne of all Creation.”

critical_analysis.relevance: The Demonic Bible presents a radical synthesis of Western Esoteric traditions, positioning itself as the foundational text for a new magical age – the 'Aeon of Lucifer'. It uniquely integrates elements from Thelema, Setianism, and the Order of Nine Angles (ONA) to propose a system of 'deitic magic' focused on individual self-deification. By reinterpreting Satan as the dynamic consciousness and Lucifer as a metaphor for humanity's ultimate purpose, it offers a distinct Left-Hand Path perspective on evolution and divinity. Its relevance lies in challenging conventional occult hierarchies, advocating for personal sovereignty over external deities, and proposing a practical, albeit psychologically intense, path for achieving godhood in the modern era. The author's personal experiences and the purported revelation by a 'Unholy Guardian Demon' ground the system in a subjective yet potent narrative, making it a significant contribution to contemporary occult literature.
critical_analysis.target_audience: The primary target audience is advanced practitioners of Western Esotericism, specifically those engaged with or exploring Left-Hand Path philosophies, Satanism, Thelema, Setianism, and Chaos Magic. The text explicitly states it's 'not an organization for followers but rather for leaders,' indicating a requirement for strong individual will, prior experience, and psychological resilience. Warnings about 'demonic possession,' 'mental illness,' and the self-destructive potential of 'looking into the abyss' underscore that this system is intended for those prepared for radical self-transformation and a complete re-evaluation of reality and morality, rather than novice or casual dabblers.
